description: Assesses ability to address and refute counterarguments

levels.4: Identifies the strongest opposing argument rather than a weak or obvious one
levels.2: Identifies an opposing view but it's a strawman or too weak
levels.1: Does not identify any opposing viewpoint

feedback_stems.strength: You identified the strongest counterargument when you addressed
feedback_stems.growth: Find the BEST argument the other side has—that makes your rebuttal more powerful

levels.4: Refutes the counterargument with clear reasoning and evidence
levels.3: Provides a reasonable response to the counterargument
levels.2: Attempts to respond but the rebuttal is weak or unclear
levels.1: No rebuttal; just states the counterargument

feedback_stems.growth: After presenting the other side, explain clearly why your position is still stronger

levels.4: Represents the opposing view fairly and accurately before countering it
levels.3: Mostly fair representation of the opposing view
levels.2: Misrepresents or oversimplifies the opposing view
levels.1: Ignores or mocks the opposing view

feedback_stems.strength: You represented the other side fairly before disagreeing
feedback_stems.growth: Present the other side's argument accurately—then your response is more convincing

levels.4: Counterargument paragraph flows naturally within the essay structure
levels.3: Counterargument is placed appropriately in the essay
levels.2: Counterargument feels disconnected from the rest of the essay
levels.1: Counterargument, if present, disrupts the essay's flow

feedback_stems.strength: Your counterargument fit smoothly into your essay
feedback_stems.growth: Use transitions like 'Some people might say...' to smoothly introduce the other side
